abstract: With so much of the publishing industry shifting to the Web, magazine executives are trying to use their print products as a tactical advantage with advertisers.
snippet: With so much of the publishing industry shifting to the Web, magazine executives are trying to use their print products as a tactical advantage with advertisers.
lead_paragraph: READERS of the latest issue of People magazine may have been startled to open to a bulky page in the middle and hear Natasha Bedingfield’s latest pop song start playing out loud. It was courtesy of a large ad for Verizon Wireless’s music download service  and a tiny battery and speaker wedged within the pages of the magazine.

headline.main: More Bells, Whistles and Packets of All Sorts
headline.print_headline: More Bells, Whistles And Packets of All Sorts
